text:
Surprise and Sorrow

A dim room, Raskolnikov fidgeting anxiously.  
He feels overwhelmed.  
Raskolnikov: “What a sensation I’ll make!”  

Sonia quietly approaches with two crosses.  
Sonia: “Here, take this one.”  
Raskolnikov: “The wooden cross? I’ve suffered enough!”  

---
A heavy atmosphere, tension thick in the air.  
Raskolnikov struggles with his thoughts.  
Raskolnikov: “I came to warn you, Sonia.”  

Sonia: “Why are you crying?”  
Raskolnikov: “Don’t! I hate all of this!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles with his emotions and the weight of his actions as he prepares to face the consequences of his choices, while Sonia offers him comfort and support.
